title: Eleven SSPs transferred with immediate effect
byline: Sri Lanka Police announced that a total of eleven Senior Superintendents of Police (SSPs) have been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: JICA Senior Vice President meets PM Harini to strengthen bilateral cooperation
byline: Mr. Shohei Hara, Senior Vice President of the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), has paid a courtesy call on the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, at the Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: E-service for copies of birth, marriage and death certificates for overseas Sri Lankans launched
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath in partnership with the Registrar General’s Department has launched the pilot project to facilitate overseas Sri Lankans to obtain certified copies of birth, marriage, and death certificates through Sri Lanka Missions abroad.

title: Wildfire rages in Los Angeles, forcing 30,000 to evacuate
byline: A rapidly growing wildfire raged across an upscale section of Los Angeles on Tuesday, destroying homes and creating traffic jams as 30,000 people evacuated beneath huge plumes of smoke that covered much of the metropolitan area.

title: TRCSL warns public over fraudulent text messages
byline: The Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL) has issued a warning, advising the public not to share their personal details in response to fraudulent text messages circulating on social media.

title: Former State Minister Lucky Jayawardena passes away
byline: Former State Minister Lucky Jayawardena has passed away at the age of 70, family sources said.

title: Teacher interdicted for leaking term test questions in North Central Province
byline: The teacher responsible for leaking the questions of the Grade 6 and 7 Term Test of government schools in North Central Province has been interdicted with immediate effect, the North Central Province Education Secretary said.

title: CBSL’s Policy Agenda for 2025 and Beyond to be unveiled today
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) is scheduled to hold an event on the “Central Bank’s Policy Agenda for 2025 and Beyond” today (08) at 10.00 a.m. in the Atrium of the CBSL Head Office.

title: Sri Lankan insurers to tackle profitability pressure with key shifts - Fitch
byline: Underwriting profitability for Sri Lankan non-life insurers will gradually improve as they enhance practices and shift focus to more profitable non-motor segments, Fitch Ratings says in a new report.

title: ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ programme to be debated in Parliament
byline: The Government’s ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ national initiative is to be taken up for debate in Parliament on January 21 and 22, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said in the Parliament today (08)
